[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'X86-7', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-10-04 19:25:27+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '### Before you start...

- [X] Have you refreshed the page? You might be using an old version of the site.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox

### Description

When looking at the previewed images of Files V2, the front of the landing page and part in front of the Windows 11 Background is strictly 50% transparent and theres no blur, like it is on other browsers.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Go to the website
2. Take a look at the first part of the landing page
3. Take a look under the landing page where it says **Power meets beauty.**

### Expected behavior

The background should have a Gaussian blur.

### Relevant Assets

![Screenshot (3)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84218614/135911996-232aa699-3816-4590-8152-84082d974d5b.png)', 'title': 'Background is not acrylic, its slightly transparent.', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'TheOnlyTails', 'comment_id': 933813910.0, 'datetime': '2021-10-04 20:05:40+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': "The background blur here relies on the `backdrop-filter` CSS property, which is locked behind a flag in Firefox, meaning we can't fix this.", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'closed', 'author': 'TheOnlyTails', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-10-04 20:05:40+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Background is not acrylic, its slightly transparent.
username_0: ### Before you start...

- [X] Have you refreshed the page? You might be using an old version of the site.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox

### Description

When looking at the previewed images of Files V2, the front of the landing page and part in front of the Windows 11 Background is strictly 50% transparent and theres no blur, like it is on other browsers.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Go to the website
2. Take a look at the first part of the landing page
3. Take a look under the landing page where it says **Power meets beauty.**

### Expected behavior

The background should have a Gaussian blur.

### Relevant Assets

![Screenshot (3)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84218614/135911996-232aa699-3816-4590-8152-84082d974d5b.png)
<issue_comment>username_1: The background blur here relies on the `backdrop-filter` CSS property, which is locked behind a flag in Firefox, meaning we can't fix this.<issue_closed>

Co-founder at CoinGecko here, it is great to see Ethereum.org using the CoinGecko API to power pricing pages
But I am also noticing a bug that it is making infinite requests to the API which is in a way of waste of bandwidth on our end for the free API that we are providing. I don't supposed that is intended.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. I dont know if any other pages are impacted, but visit https://ethereum.org/en/stablecoins/
2. Open network inspector

**Expected behavior**
API should be made once or only sufficient to display the value rather than calling it in a loop

**Screenshots**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110264/111655179-63e46c00-8844-11eb-9abe-a17ba0d945da.mov

- Chrome

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Infinite request made to CoinGecko API endpoints
username_0: **Describe the bug**
Co-founder at CoinGecko here, it is great to see Ethereum.org using the CoinGecko API to power pricing pages
But I am also noticing a bug that it is making infinite requests to the API which is in a way of waste of bandwidth on our end for the free API that we are providing. I don't supposed that is intended.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. I dont know if any other pages are impacted, but visit https://ethereum.org/en/stablecoins/
2. Open network inspector 
3. You will see an infinite requests is being made to the API

**Expected behavior**
API should be made once or only sufficient to display the value rather than calling it in a loop

**Screenshots**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110264/111655179-63e46c00-8844-11eb-9abe-a17ba0d945da.mov



**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
Tested on
- OS: Mac
- Chrome
- 89.0.4389.82

but should be applicable across browsers
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 Thank you so much for reporting this (and of course for providing this service to begin with!). Definitely not intended, and will work to address this right away.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_2: Yes thanks for the report @username_0! We've fixed the issue (thanks @username_1) & added caching to help reduce the load. Will deploy the fix shortly.
<issue_comment>username_2: BTW @username_0 - any timeline to support `stablecoins` as a market category in your API üòÑ ? Would be great to have.
https://twitter.com/samonchain/status/1335999786865070081?s=20

Appreciate your free API in the meantime! Thanks for all you do for the community.
<issue_comment>username_2: @all-contributors please add @username_0 for bug reports.
<issue_comment>username_0: That's a good feedback, I will see how we can have that supported soon. Will let you know here when it is up and running.
Feel free to let me know if there is anything else that you all need.
<issue_comment>username_0: Hi @username_2 , just a quick update that you can do this now with the following endpoint https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/coins/markets?vs_currency=usd&category=stablecoins&order=market_cap_desc&per_page=100&page=1&sparkline=false

Let me know what you think!

[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'anthonyfok', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2016-06-13T14:46:15Z', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'The Debian build daemon fails to build hugo_0.16-1 on alpha, mips, mipsel, mips64el and powerpc architectures (using gccgo) due to the following error when compiling golang.org/x/sys/unix:

```
dh_auto_build -O--buildsystem=golang
    go install -v github.com/spf13/hugo github.com/spf13/hugo/bufferpool github.com/spf13/hugo/commands github.com/spf13/hugo/create github.com/spf13/hugo/helpers github.com/spf13/hugo/hugofs github.com/spf13/hugo/hugolib github.com/spf13/hugo/livereload github.com/spf13/hugo/parser github.com/spf13/hugo/source github.com/spf13/hugo/target github.com/spf13/hugo/tpl github.com/spf13/hugo/transform github.com/spf13/hugo/utils github.com/spf13/hugo/watcher
golang.org/x/sys/unix
github.com/kardianos/osext
github.com/kr/fs
github.com/pkg/errors
# golang.org/x/sys/unix
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/flock.go:15:30: error: reference to undefined name 'SYS_FCNTL'
 var fcntl64Syscall uintptr = SYS_FCNTL
                              ^
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/sockcmsg_linux.go:15:30: error: reference to undefined name 'SizeofUcred'
  b := make([]byte, CmsgSpace(SizeofUcred))
                              ^
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/sockcmsg_linux.go:16:9: error: reference to undefined name 'Cmsghdr'
  h := (*Cmsghdr)(unsafe.Pointer(&b[0]))
         ^
```

and many more lines after that, see https://buildd.debian.org/status/package.php?p=hugo&suite=sid for the overall view.

Individual build logs:
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=alpha&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465835430
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=mips&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794978
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=mipsel&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794863
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=mips64el&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794891
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=powerpc&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794682

Note that `gccgo` are used on these platforms, though s390x and gccgo builds hugo just fine (except a failed test in #2206), I would still say the culprit is probably at golang.org/x/sys/unix.

It might also have to do with Debian still using go1.6.1 without some related backported fixes that went into go1.6.2.  (Wait, no, that is golang-go, not gccgo...)

TODO: Reproduce on Debian test "porterbox" servers, come up with an MWE (minimal working example) if necessary, and report back upstream.', 'title': '[alpha mips{,el,64el} powerpc] Compile error at golang.org/x/sys/unix', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'closed', 'author': 'bep', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2017-09-22 22:48:48+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'anthonyfok', 'comment_id': 331701989.0, 'datetime': '2017-09-24 10:51:08+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'Just a final status update at the closing of this issue (Thanks @ username_1):

According to https://buildd.debian.org/status/package.php?p=hugo, as of Hugo 0.25.1, MIPS architecture (mips, mipsel, mips64el) now builds successfully (Hurray!), so only alpha and powerpc remains.

And now that I understand the problem a little better: This issue has ~little~ nothing to do with Hugo itself, but rather with golang.org/x/sys adding support (e.g. Linux kernel headers, etc.) for alpha and powerpc, both which are somewhat obsolete anyway, so not a big deal.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'anthonyfok', 'comment_id': 726736404.0, 'datetime': '2020-11-13 12:24:29+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'Please see follow up at https://github.com/golang/go/issues/18031.

PowerPC ((linux/ppc) architecture support is being reviewed at https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/sys/+/262517', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: [alpha mips{,el,64el} powerpc] Compile error at golang.org/x/sys/unix
username_0: The Debian build daemon fails to build hugo_0.16-1 on alpha, mips, mipsel, mips64el and powerpc architectures (using gccgo) due to the following error when compiling golang.org/x/sys/unix:

```
dh_auto_build -O--buildsystem=golang
    go install -v github.com/spf13/hugo github.com/spf13/hugo/bufferpool github.com/spf13/hugo/commands github.com/spf13/hugo/create github.com/spf13/hugo/helpers github.com/spf13/hugo/hugofs github.com/spf13/hugo/hugolib github.com/spf13/hugo/livereload github.com/spf13/hugo/parser github.com/spf13/hugo/source github.com/spf13/hugo/target github.com/spf13/hugo/tpl github.com/spf13/hugo/transform github.com/spf13/hugo/utils github.com/spf13/hugo/watcher
golang.org/x/sys/unix
github.com/kardianos/osext
github.com/kr/fs
github.com/pkg/errors
# golang.org/x/sys/unix
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/flock.go:15:30: error: reference to undefined name 'SYS_FCNTL'
 var fcntl64Syscall uintptr = SYS_FCNTL
                              ^
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/sockcmsg_linux.go:15:30: error: reference to undefined name 'SizeofUcred'
  b := make([]byte, CmsgSpace(SizeofUcred))
                              ^
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/sockcmsg_linux.go:16:9: error: reference to undefined name 'Cmsghdr'
  h := (*Cmsghdr)(unsafe.Pointer(&b[0]))
         ^
```

and many more lines after that, see https://buildd.debian.org/status/package.php?p=hugo&suite=sid for the overall view.

Individual build logs:
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=alpha&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465835430
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=mips&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794978
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=mipsel&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794863
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=mips64el&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794891
- https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=hugo&arch=powerpc&ver=0.16-1&stamp=1465794682

Note that `gccgo` are used on these platforms, though s390x and gccgo builds hugo just fine (except a failed test in #2206), I would still say the culprit is probably at golang.org/x/sys/unix.

It might also have to do with Debian still using go1.6.1 without some related backported fixes that went into go1.6.2.  (Wait, no, that is golang-go, not gccgo...)

TODO: Reproduce on Debian test "porterbox" servers, come up with an MWE (minimal working example) if necessary, and report back upstream.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: Just a final status update at the closing of this issue (Thanks @ username_1):

According to https://buildd.debian.org/status/package.php?p=hugo, as of Hugo 0.25.1, MIPS architecture (mips, mipsel, mips64el) now builds successfully (Hurray!), so only alpha and powerpc remains.

And now that I understand the problem a little better: This issue has ~little~ nothing to do with Hugo itself, but rather with golang.org/x/sys adding support (e.g. Linux kernel headers, etc.) for alpha and powerpc, both which are somewhat obsolete anyway, so not a big deal.
<issue_comment>username_0: Please see follow up at https://github.com/golang/go/issues/18031.

PowerPC ((linux/ppc) architecture support is being reviewed at https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/sys/+/262517

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: [RDU-2022] Small program tweaks

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: PrepareNode.ps1 fails when run from PowerShell ISE
username_0: The script fails when started from PowerShell ISE. It took me a while to figure that out, so a warning could help others.

```ps1
tar : x nssm.exe
At line:1 char:1
+ tar C "$global:NssmInstallDirectory" -xvf .\nssm.zip --strip-componen ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (x nssm.exe:String) [], RemoteException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NativeCommandError
```

This doesn't happen when run from a standard/stand-alone PowerShell window.

```ps1
$PSVersionTable

Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                       
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                       
PSVersion                      5.1.17763.1432                                                                                                                                                              
PSEdition                      Desktop                                                                                                                                                                     
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                     
BuildVersion                   10.0.17763.1432                                                                                                                                                             
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000                                                                                                                                                             
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                                         
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                         
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                                                     
```

Hope this PR helps. Feel free to formulate it differently, English is not my native language, so I'll take no offense in that. ;-)
<issue_comment>username_0: No, thanks.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: add ygrene and remove logo spinning
username_0: This adds Ygrene Energy Fund to the list of companies present and also removes the CSS animation that makes logos spin. The first one I'd like to have for sure, the animation I can remove, but I feel that it detracts from the companies when the `:hover` state is fired in the DOM
<issue_comment>username_0: I signed it!
<issue_comment>username_0: /assign   username_1
/cc linsun rshriram smawson louiscryan
<issue_comment>username_1: I've received a lot of comments about folks loving the whimsy of the fidget-spinner animations we use there, so I'd like to keep that as-is. Would you just add the company logo without the animation change please?
<issue_comment>username_0: Yep! @username_1 will do. Thanks üòÑ
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 Just pushed

[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'minimalsm', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-09-01 09:12:22+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

We recently removed a dapp tool that was no longer maintained and in doing so noticed [we are missing some useful dapp tools ](https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/pull/3740#issuecomment-907865282)from this page.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
- Add [create-eth-app](https://github.com/paulrberg/create-eth-app) and [scaffold-eth](https://github.com/austintgriffith/scaffold-eth) to the dapp tools section of our [dapps developer docs page](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/dapps/)
- Ideally link to an official example dapp also

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None

**Additional context**
#3734
#3740
#3779

**Want to contribute?**

We love contributions from the Ethereum community! Please comment on an issue if you're interested in helping out with a PR.", 'title': 'Add to create-eth-app and scaffold-eth dapp tools', 'type': 'issue'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Add to create-eth-app and scaffold-eth dapp tools
username_0: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

We recently removed a dapp tool that was no longer maintained and in doing so noticed [we are missing some useful dapp tools ](https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/pull/3740#issuecomment-907865282)from this page.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
- Add [create-eth-app](https://github.com/paulrberg/create-eth-app) and [scaffold-eth](https://github.com/austintgriffith/scaffold-eth) to the dapp tools section of our [dapps developer docs page](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/dapps/)
- Ideally link to an official example dapp also

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None

**Additional context**
#3734
#3740
#3779

**Want to contribute?**

We love contributions from the Ethereum community! Please comment on an issue if you're interested in helping out with a PR.
<issue_comment>username_1: thanks @username_0, I would like to contribute in this.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 thanks! Assigned you üëç Let me know if you need a hand in any way.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 I am currently checking with teams of both the above mentioned tools for any actively hosted dapp sample apps.

In the mean time I need your suggestion on adding the same in all the translation files as it needs to be translated in the respective language, like I have added below in the English version and want to do the same in other translation files too.
```
**Create Eth App** **_- Create Ethereum-powered apps with one command._**

- [GitHub](https://github.com/paulrberg/create-eth-app)
- [Example dapp]()

**Scaffold-ETH** **_- Quickly experiment with Solidity using a frontend that adapts to your smart contract._**

- [GitHub](https://github.com/austintgriffith/scaffold-eth)
- [Example dapp](https://punkwallet.io/)
```

column6:
Title: border may be ignored username_0: ### What version of Hugo are you using (`hugo version`)? 
PS (PowerShell)> hugo version
Hugo Static Site Generator v0.60.0-F2DEA9B0 windows/amd64 BuildDate: 2019-11-27T10:11:05Z
### Does this issue reproduce with the latest release? Yes ### Problem description There is this Markdown as a test: ``` **test**\ test**test**\ **test**test\ test**test** ``` In Hugo v0.60.0, the output is as follows: ![„Çπ„ÇØ„É™„Éº„É≥„Ç∑„Éß„ÉÉ„Éà 2019-11-28 13 33 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5434159/69777498-e2e30a80-11e3-11ea-9b74-3a13e61f6907.jpg) Some \ are not converted to
: ```

test\ testtest\ testtest
testtest

``` Since v0.59.1 was handled normally, this may require some Markdown modifications. username_1: goldmark author here, I've fixed the issue and released the new version. username_0: Thank you for the quick fix! I updated to Hugo v.0.60.1 and confirmed this fix.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Fedora package outdated.
username_0: Hugo is quite outdated in the [Fedora package repository](https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/hugo). Is there anybody who might be willing to contact the maintainer and take over responsibility?
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 While this doesn't address your original question, since you want to use a package manager to install/manage hugo, is using snap an option for you? Snap also includes latest hugo dev versions. 

https://snapcraft.io/hugo
<issue_comment>username_0: Personally I don't use Snaps, but thank you for making me aware that it's available. I have installed Hugo manually for now. Though, the Hugo installation is so simple that maybe it's not worth chasing after package maintainers. An autoupdate or update notice functionality in Hugo would make it acceptable to not provide distribution packages, in my opinion.
<issue_comment>username_2: I think, given the manpower we got, I will close this. Opening up a thread on https://discourse.gohugo.io/ may be a better road to take.<issue_closed>

column5:
[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'boyney123', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-10-06 14:53:48+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "#### Reason/Context
Please try answering a few of those questions

I'm in the process of going through and learning as much as I can about AsyncAPI, through examples, spec, etc.

I just watched this video from @fmvilas https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2pqCIhXQ3k&t=2025s about `Zero to AsyncAPI` which was great, it has some good content in there for anyone that wants to learn.

Maybe we can embed a link to the video on the website somewhere? My suggestion maybe here?

https://www.asyncapi.com/docs/getting-started

I guess long term maybe we could make a shorter (this is 1.5 hours) version of this talk, and give a 10minute walkthrough of what AsyncAPI is. (I don't mind giving this ago once I learn more and am confident enough to do it).

### Why

I think it will just help people that are visual/video learners vs tutorial-based learning.", 'title': 'doc: Adding video to "Getting Started" section', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'alequetzalli', 'comment_id': 983183174.0, 'datetime': '2021-12-01 01:04:51+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'Odyssey is a **React application built with Gatsby and MDX and deployed with Netlify**. These tools were an easy first choice for our team, because several other Apollo web properties (the documentation, blog, and developer hub) already use them. We know how they work, and we know they work well! .... To power our interactive coding challenges, we use\xa0Netlify Functions. The reader‚Äôs code is passed to a serverless function that executes tests against the code in a Node.js environment, then returns the results to the browser.


Source:
https://www.apollographql.com/blog/platform/how-we-built-odyssey/', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'derberg', 'comment_id': 983579623.0, 'datetime': '2021-12-01 12:09:02+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_2', 'text': "well, I know you talk about it at conferences, that you organize Docs work this way, but this is not part of the contribution guide, and we should not disqualify an issue just because somebody did not watch your presentation üòÑ (reminding again, this is old issue). The way you organize work on docs is pretty unusual here in AsyncAPI so it should not affect contributors too much, it should rather help them contribute, and therefore I think it is your responsibility as a maintainer to triage issues from this repo and add/remove them from the board, or drive discussion.

We should be more liberal as maintainers. The current contribution guide describes `ideal` (this word is used) workflow. It is not always required to open an issue if the change is super small. It is ok to hold a discussion on the PR level too, sometimes it is even better, for example in the `spec` repo we encourage PR over the issue. We describe the `ideal` world in the Contributor guide to defend contributors, so in case they want to make a great PR with some functionality, that required lots of work but was not aligned initially - thus lots of time was wasted, and we suggest an issue first.

---

tl;dr we need more flexibility IMHO, especially when change is driven by feedback and can't be super picky on every single rule üòÑ", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: doc: Adding video to "Getting Started" section
username_0: #### Reason/Context
Please try answering a few of those questions

I'm in the process of going through and learning as much as I can about AsyncAPI, through examples, spec, etc.

I just watched this video from @fmvilas https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2pqCIhXQ3k&t=2025s about `Zero to AsyncAPI` which was great, it has some good content in there for anyone that wants to learn.

Maybe we can embed a link to the video on the website somewhere? My suggestion maybe here?

https://www.asyncapi.com/docs/getting-started

I guess long term maybe we could make a shorter (this is 1.5 hours) version of this talk, and give a 10minute walkthrough of what AsyncAPI is. (I don't mind giving this ago once I learn more and am confident enough to do it).

### Why

I think it will just help people that are visual/video learners vs tutorial-based learning.
<issue_comment>username_1: Odyssey is a **React application built with Gatsby and MDX and deployed with Netlify**. These tools were an easy first choice for our team, because several other Apollo web properties (the documentation, blog, and developer hub) already use them. We know how they work, and we know they work well! .... To power our interactive coding challenges, we use¬†Netlify Functions. The reader‚Äôs code is passed to a serverless function that executes tests against the code in a Node.js environment, then returns the results to the browser.


Source:
https://www.apollographql.com/blog/platform/how-we-built-odyssey/
<issue_comment>username_2: well, I know you talk about it at conferences, that you organize Docs work this way, but this is not part of the contribution guide, and we should not disqualify an issue just because somebody did not watch your presentation üòÑ (reminding again, this is old issue). The way you organize work on docs is pretty unusual here in AsyncAPI so it should not affect contributors too much, it should rather help them contribute, and therefore I think it is your responsibility as a maintainer to triage issues from this repo and add/remove them from the board, or drive discussion.

We should be more liberal as maintainers. The current contribution guide describes `ideal` (this word is used) workflow. It is not always required to open an issue if the change is super small. It is ok to hold a discussion on the PR level too, sometimes it is even better, for example in the `spec` repo we encourage PR over the issue. We describe the `ideal` world in the Contributor guide to defend contributors, so in case they want to make a great PR with some functionality, that required lots of work but was not aligned initially - thus lots of time was wasted, and we suggest an issue first.

---

tl;dr we need more flexibility IMHO, especially when change is driven by feedback and can't be super picky on every single rule üòÑ
